News.Title: SEBI Penalizes Zee Promoter Rs 4 Lakh for Violations
News.Summary: SEBI imposed Rs 4,00,000 penalty on Cyquator Media Services, a Zee Entertainment promoter, for takeover regulation violations related to share pledge disclosures in 2016-2019.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Appoints Sandeep Mehrotra as COO
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment strengthens leadership with appointment of Sandeep Mehrotra as Chief Operating Officer - Advertisement Revenue, effective February 3, 2026, to drive integrated revenue growth.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Q3 FY26 Digital Business Turns Profitable
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment's digital business achieved first-ever positive EBITDA of INR 564 million in Q3 FY26, driven by 73% revenue growth to INR 4,180 million.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Updates RTA Contact Details
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited announces updated contact information for its Registrar and Share Transfer Agent, MUFG Intime India Private Limited, including new telephone, email, and website details.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Defers FCCB Drawdowns
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises has deferred the next drawdowns for its Foreign Currency Convertible Bonds (FCCB), citing the need for full visibility on deployment of proceeds before proceeding.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Eyes ZEE5 Growth & Profitability
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises positions ZEE5 as fastest-growing vertical with management focusing on improved returns and positive unit economics in medium term during recent concall.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment shares surge 4% ahead of Q3 results
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment shares jumped 4% to ₹85.15 on Thursday ahead of Q3 results, breaking a four-day losing streak that saw the stock decline over 9%.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Faces ₹1.2B Tax Demand Upheld
News.Summary: Adjudicating authority upholds tax demand notices totaling ₹1.2 billion against Zee Entertainment, marking significant regulatory development for the entertainment company.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Faces GST Demands Worth ₹1,196 Cr
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment receives adjudication orders from CGST Commissioner upholding tax demands of ₹869 million and ₹327 million related to disputed input tax credits from vendor transactions.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Clarifies Workforce Optimization Following Media Reports on Layoffs
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment provided clarification to BSE regarding news reports about layoffs, explaining that the company is re-modeling and integrating business divisions as part of an omni-channel approach to create a more agile organization structure. The company referenced a previous press release from April 5, 2024, where management proposed rationalizing workforce by 15% over a period, stating this optimization exercise is ongoing based on business dynamics with no impact on operations or performance.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Shareholders Approve R Gopalan's Appointment as Non-Executive Director
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment shareholders passed a resolution appointing R Gopalan (DIN: 01624555) as Non-Executive, Non-Independent Director through postal ballot voting that concluded on November 28, 2025. The resolution received 53.1667% votes in favor from 1,599 members casting 23,66,57,454 valid votes, while 46.8333% voted against with 20,84,66,187 votes.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Achieves Top 5% Global ESG Ranking in Media Sector
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises scored 51 out of 100 in the SP Global Corporate Sustainability Assessment 2025, placing it among the top 5% companies in the global media, movies and entertainment segment. The company achieved significant improvements in corporate governance, supply chain management, climate governance and human capital management, with transparency reporting scoring in the 100th percentile.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Seeks Shareholder Approval for R Gopalan's Transition from Independent to Non-Executive Director
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited has issued a postal ballot notice seeking shareholder approval to appoint R Gopalan as Non-Executive, Non-Independent Director. Gopalan has served as Independent Director since November 2019 and his second term expires on November 24, 2025. The Board approved his appointment as Additional Director effective November 25, 2025, based on Nomination & Remuneration Committee's recommendation. Gopalan, 73, holds degrees from Harvard University and Boston University, with over 40 years of experience including positions as Secretary in Finance Ministry departments. He has served as Board Chairman for 6 years and holds directorships in multiple listed companies including Sundaram-Clayton Limited, TVS Holdings Limited, and Vedanta Limited. The remote e-voting period runs from October 30 to November 28, 2025, with results to be announced by November 29, 2025. National Securities Depository Limited will provide the e-voting facility, with Vinita Nair appointed as Scrutinizer for the voting process.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Reports Q2 FY26 Results with Mixed Performance Amid Strategic Investments
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises reported quarterly results with advertising revenue declining 11% year-over-year but growing 6% sequentially, driven by FMCG sector spending. The company's network share increased to 17.8%, gaining 100 basis points quarter-over-quarter, with 7 channels achieving leadership positions in their respective markets. ZEE5 digital platform recorded highest quarterly revenue crossing INR 3,000 million with 32% year-over-year growth, reducing EBITDA losses by over 80% to INR 312 million. The company launched tailored subscription plans in seven languages and introduced new content across platforms. Operating costs increased 9% year-over-year due to higher programming and advertising expenses from new show launches and two new GEC channels in Kannada and Bangla markets. EBITDA margins compressed to 7.4% during the quarter. Cash and treasury investments stood at INR 21.1 billion as of September 2025. Management expressed cautious optimism for the second half, expecting cost stabilization and revenue uptick from festive season spending and recent GST reforms. The company is pursuing an omnichannel content strategy and exploring new segments including short-form content.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Cuts Ad Revenue Growth Forecast and May Miss Margin Targets
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment has revised its advertising revenue growth estimate downward from the previously projected 6-8% due to weak performance in the first half. The company indicated it may not achieve its earlier margin guidance of 18-20% citing current market conditions. While management avoided providing specific guidance for H2 FY26, they expressed optimism for progress, pointing to the upcoming festive season and improved network share as positive factors.

News.Title: ZEEL Expects Strong EBITDA and Cash Flow Recovery Through Cost Optimization and Digital Focus
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited anticipates a significant rebound in EBITDA and cash flows following its restructuring efforts. The company plans to achieve this recovery through content cost rationalization, increased focus on high-return digital ventures, and enhanced monetization strategies for its sports and OTT platforms.

News.Title: ZEEL Executive Expresses Doubts About FY26 Revenue Growth Target
News.Summary: A ZEEL executive has stated that the company's revenue growth target of 8-10% for FY26 appears challenging to achieve.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Invests Rs 15 Crores in Ideabaaz Tech and Appoints R Gopalan as Non-Executive Director
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited's Board approved an additional investment of Rs 15 crores in equity shares of Ideabaaz Tech Private Limited, acquiring a 20% stake in the media and entrepreneurship company. Ideabaaz Tech operates across three verticals - Show, Platform, and Exhibition - focusing on empowering startups in Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities. The company was incorporated on November 18, 2024, with nil turnover. This is not a related party transaction. Separately, ZEEL appointed R Gopalan as Additional Director in the Non-Executive Director category effective November 25, 2025, subject to shareholder approval. Gopalan previously served as an Independent Director and brings extensive experience from the Ministry of Finance and Ministry of Commerce & Industries, including roles as Secretary in Department of Economic Affairs and Department of Financial Services.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Reports 51% Drop in EBITDA Despite Stable Revenue
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises reported quarterly revenue of 19.69 billion rupees compared to 20 billion rupees in the same period last year. The company's EBITDA declined significantly to 1.59 billion rupees from 3.23 billion rupees year-over-year. EBITDA margin compressed to 8.07% from 16.2% in the previous year.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Board Approves Unaudited Financial Results for Quarter Ended September 30, 2025
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited's Board of Directors approved the unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter and half year ended September 30, 2025. The approval came following recommendations from the Audit Committee. The board authorized Mr. Uttam Prakash Agarwal, Independent Director and Chairperson of the Audit Committee, to sign the financial results. The board meeting was held on October 16, 2025, commencing at 11:00 a.m. and concluding at 2:45 p.m. The financial results were prepared with limited review reports from the company's statutory auditors.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Reports 62% Decline in Quarterly Net Profit
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises reported a consolidated net profit of 770 million rupees for Q2, representing a significant decrease from 2 billion rupees in the same quarter of the previous year. This marks a year-over-year decline of approximately 62% in the company's quarterly earnings.

News.Title: ZEEL Wins ₹462 Million Tax Case as CESTAT Cancels CENVAT Credit Demand
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited (ZEEL) has won a ₹462 million tax case. The Customs, Excise and Service Tax Appellate Tribunal (CESTAT) ruled in favor of the company and canceled the extended CENVAT credit demand that was imposed on ZEEL.

News.Title: ZEE Entertainment Enterprises Schedules Second Quarter Results Review for October 16
News.Summary: ZEE Entertainment Enterprises has announced it will review its second quarter results on October 16. The media and entertainment company has set this date for the quarterly earnings review.

News.Title: IDBI Bank Files Insolvency Application Against Zee Entertainment for Rs. 225 Crores Default
News.Summary: IDBI Bank Limited has filed an application before the National Company Law Tribunal, Mumbai Bench for initiation of Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process against Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited, claiming a default of Rs. 225.23 crores. The claim arises under a Debt Service Reserve Agreement related to credit facilities availed by Siti Networks Ltd. from the bank. Zee Entertainment strongly disputes the claim, calling it malicious, fraudulent and meritless. The company states this is the bank's third attempt regarding the same debt - previous applications filed in 2022 under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code were dismissed by NCLT in May 2023, with an appeal also dismissed in April 2025. A separate application under the Recovery of Debts and Bankruptcy Act was dismissed in January 2025. Zee Entertainment plans to contest the current application and may pursue legal remedies against the bank for malicious prosecution and defamation. The company does not expect any financial implications given the bank's previous unsuccessful attempts.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Chief Growth Officer Ashish Sehgal Resigns After 20 Years
News.Summary: Ashish Sehgal, Chief Growth Officer for Ad Sales, Broadcast & Digital at Zee Entertainment Enterprises Ltd (ZEEL), has resigned citing personal reasons after nearly two decades with the company. Sehgal played a pivotal role in driving advertisement revenue across Zee's broadcast and digital businesses. The company has elevated Laxmi Shetty as the new Head of Advertisement Revenue, Broadcast & Digital, who will report directly to CEO Punit Goenka. Shetty has been with the leadership team for over 20 years and will lead monetization efforts across linear and digital platforms. ZEEL shares closed 1.8% lower at Rs 118.20 on Tuesday, with investors expected to monitor the stock closely following this leadership change amid a competitive media landscape.

News.Title: ZEEL Promotes Laxmi Shetty to Head Advertisement Revenue Role, Ashish Sehgal Steps Down
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited (ZEEL) has promoted Laxmi Shetty to the position of Head – Advertisement Revenue, Broadcast & Digital. Simultaneously, Ashish Sehgal has resigned from his role as Chief Growth Officer.

News.Title: ABFL Challenges Tribunal Award Against ZEEL in Delhi High Court
News.Summary: Aditya Birla Finance Limited (ABFL) has filed a petition with the Delhi High Court against an award related to Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited (ZEEL). A tribunal has denied all claims made by ABFL against ZEEL in this matter.

News.Title: ZEEL Plans Investment of Up To 900M Rupees in Two Media Companies
News.Summary: ZEEL announced plans to invest up to 500 million rupees in Optionally Convertible Debentures (OCDS) of ZBullet Enterprises and up to 400 million rupees in OCDS of Advance Media Distribution. The total planned investment amounts to 900 million rupees across these two entities.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Sets August 29, 2025 as Record Date for Rs. 2.43 Per Share Dividend
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited has fixed Friday, August 29, 2025, as the record date for determining shareholder eligibility for dividend payment of Rs. 2.43 per equity share of Re. 1 each for financial year 2024-25. The Board of Directors had recommended this dividend on May 8, 2025. Shareholders holding equity shares on the record date will be eligible for the dividend payment.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Reports 14% PAT Growth in Q1 FY26, Viewership Share Reaches 16.8%
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises reported a 14% year-on-year increase in profit after tax to INR 1,437 million for Q1 FY26. The company's linear viewership share improved to 16.8% during the quarter, reaching 17.8% in June and crossing 18% in July. ZEE5 digital revenues grew 30% year-on-year, while the company reduced digital EBITDA losses by INR 1,119 million. Overall operating costs declined 14% due to efficient programming execution and cost optimization. The company maintained EBITDA margins at 12.5% despite soft advertising environment. Cash and treasury investments stood at INR 21.9 billion as of June 2025. Management introduced language-specific subscription packs for ZEE5 and entered strategic partnerships with content startups. The company maintains its 8% advertising growth guidance for the year, expecting benefits from new retail advertiser initiatives and improved ratings in the second half.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Reports Q1 FY26 Results, Faces USD 1.003 Billion Arbitration Claim from JioStar
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited approved its unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company reported standalone revenue from operations of Rs 16,839 million and profit of Rs 1,125 million for the quarter. On a consolidated basis, total income was Rs 18,498 million with profit of Rs 1,181 million. The company faces significant legal challenges including an ongoing SEBI investigation regarding certain vendor transactions and a major arbitration dispute with JioStar India Private Limited (formerly Star India). JioStar has updated its damage claim to USD 1,003 million related to ICC cricket broadcasting rights, while Zee has filed a counterclaim of USD 8.06 million. The company's Independent Investigation Committee found no material irregularities in the SEBI-investigated transactions, though a settlement application was rejected. Zee also announced its 43rd Annual General Meeting scheduled for September 15, 2025.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Shares Drop 6% as Revenue Declines 14% in Q1
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises shares fell 6.2% to Rs 133.10 following disappointing quarterly results. The company reported a 14% year-on-year decline in revenue from operations to Rs 1,825 crore, with a 16% quarter-on-quarter drop. Despite revenue challenges, consolidated net profit grew 22% to Rs 144 crore compared to Rs 118 crore in the previous year. However, profit attributable to shareholders declined 24% sequentially from Rs 188 crore. The revenue decline was primarily driven by the 'Other sales and services' segment, which dropped significantly to Rs 85 crore from Rs 360 crore in the previous quarter. Advertisement revenue decreased to Rs 758 crore from Rs 911 crore year-on-year, while subscription revenue remained relatively stable at Rs 982 crore. Over the past year, Zee shares have declined marginally by 0.15%, though they show positive momentum with a 9.22% year-to-date gain and 13.85% growth over six months.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Expects 9% Revenue Decline in Quarterly Results Due to Seasonal Weakness
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises is set to report quarterly results with revenue expected to decline 9% to ₹1,948.10 crore compared to ₹2,130.53 crore in the same quarter last year. Adjusted net profit is projected to grow 3% to ₹158.83 crore, driven by higher other income. EBITDA is likely to decrease 8% to ₹247.61 crore, while margins may remain flat at 12.7% due to cost control measures. The quarter is seasonally weak due to shift to IPL-led ads, with brokerages expecting 14-15% decline in ad revenues but 3-6% rise in subscription revenue led by Zee5. This would mark the ninth consecutive quarter of subscription revenue growth. The company's shares are trading 1.44% lower at ₹139.80 ahead of results, though the stock is up 14% year-to-date.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment: Shareholder Vote Fails for Promoter Warrants
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment's special resolution to issue convertible warrants worth ₹2,237 crore to promoters failed to secure the required 75% shareholder approval. Only 59.5% voted in favor, while 40.5% opposed. This follows earlier recommendations by proxy firms to vote against the issue due to concerns over fund-raising rationale and potential shareholder dilution.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Enterprises Ltd: Shareholders Approve ₹2,237 Crore Promoter Fund Infusion
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment shareholders approved a ₹2,237 crore capital infusion from promoters through preferential allotment of convertible warrants. The resolution passed with 60% support, mainly from retail investors. This comes months after shareholders rejected the reappointment of Punit Goenka to the board.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment: Shareholders Reject Promoters' Rs 2,237-Crore Stake Hike Proposal
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment shareholders voted against a proposal to raise Rs 2,237 crore through warrant issuance to promoters. The resolution failed as it did not receive the required three times more votes in favor than against. The proposed fundraise would have increased promoter stake to 18.39%, with Sunbright Mauritius Investments Ltd. subscribing to over 99% of the warrants.

News.Title: ZEEL Investors Reject Proposal for Warrants Issuance
News.Summary: Investors of ZEEL (Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited) have voted against a proposal to issue warrants to important shareholder groups. The plan was rejected with 40.49% of votes cast against it.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment: Shareholders Approve New Board Appointments
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment shareholders approved the appointment of Divya Karani as Independent Director and Saurav Adhikari as Non-Executive Director through e-voting. Over 75% votes favored the appointments, seen as reinforcing governance and aligning with strategic priorities.

News.Title: ZEEL Shareholders Approve Two New Directors
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited (ZEEL) has announced that its shareholders have approved the appointment of Divya Karani and Saurav Adhikari as directors of the company. This decision was made through a voting process, indicating a change in the company's board composition.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment: Proxy Firm SES Revises Stance, Supports Warrant Issue
News.Summary: Proxy advisory firm SES has changed its recommendation and now supports Zee Entertainment's resolution to issue convertible warrants to the Promoter Group. The decision came after Zee addressed SES's concerns about pricing. The warrant issue, priced at ₹132 per warrant, will raise ₹2,240 crore and increase promoter stake from 4% to 18%.

News.Title: ZEEL Plans Strategic Expansion and OTT Growth
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited (ZEEL) has announced plans for strategic acquisitions, focusing on sports, gaming, and international markets. The company aims to expand into new areas such as experiential entertainment, immersive content, and edutainment. ZEEL will continue investing in regional and global content to strengthen its market presence. Additionally, the company plans to grow its OTT platform Z5 by adding 7 language channels and increasing original content by nearly 3 times. ZEEL is focusing on enhancing Average Revenue Per User (ARPU) and aims to reach break-even for its OTT platform soon.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Enterprises Ltd: Punit Goenka Seeks Board Re-entry Through Rs 2,237 Crore Fundraise
News.Summary: Punit Goenka, part of Zee's promoter family, aims to regain board position through a Rs 2,237 crore warrants issue. Sunbright Mauritius Investments Ltd, linked to Goenka, will subscribe to over 99% of the issue, potentially converting to a 14.92% stake. This move could grant promoters board representation rights.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment: Promoters' Rs 2,237-Crore Fundraise Faces Scrutiny
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment plans to raise Rs 2,237 crore through warrants issue to promoters, increasing their stake to 18.39%. The company refuses to provide specific utilization plans, citing competitive reasons. Proxy advisory firms recommend voting against the proposal due to lack of transparency and governance concerns.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment: Proxy Firms Warn Against Rs 2,237-Crore Fundraise Plan
News.Summary: Three proxy advisory firms have advised investors to vote against Zee Entertainment's plan to raise Rs 2,237 crore through convertible warrants to promoters. Concerns include excessive dilution, governance issues, and potential inequitable treatment of shareholders. The fundraise would increase promoter holding from 3.99% to 18.39%.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment: Shares Surge on Digital Breakeven Plans
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment's stock rose 10.4% to a 10-month high of Rs 146.80 after announcing plans to achieve breakeven in its digital business Z5 by FY25. The company targets 17.5% TV viewership share, 8-10% ad revenue growth, and 18-20% operating margins for FY26. Board approves issuance of convertible warrants worth Rs 2,237 crore to strengthen capital base.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment: Z5 Breakeven Target and Growth Plans Boost Stock
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment aims for Z5 (Zee5) to break even in FY26. The company targets 17.5% TV viewership share, 8-10% ad revenue growth, and 18-20% margins. It's building a significant cash reserve, with ₹2,406 crore as of March 2025 and approved convertible warrants worth ₹2,237 crore. Growth strategies include developing new business verticals, enhancing content offerings, and potential acquisitions in high-growth areas.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Enterprises Ltd: Promoters to Inject ₹2,237 Crore via Warrant Issue
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment's board approved issuing 16.95 crore fully convertible warrants for ₹2,237 crore to promoter group entities. This will increase promoter stake from 4.28% to 18.39%. Funds will be used to strengthen the company's financial foundation and explore growth opportunities.

News.Title: Zee Entertainment Enterprises: Promoters to Inject Rs 2,237 Crore via Preferential Warrant Issue
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment's board approves issuance of 16.95 crore convertible warrants to promoter group at Rs 132 per warrant, raising Rs 2,237.44 crore. This will increase promoter stake to 18.39%. The move aims to strengthen the company's financial base and support growth initiatives in content and technology sectors.

News.Title: ZEEL Board Approves ₹22.37 Billion Fundraising Through Warrant Issue
News.Summary: The Board of Directors of Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited (ZEEL) has authorized a fundraising initiative of up to ₹22.37 billion. This will be accomplished by issuing 169.5 million warrants, each priced at ₹132 per share.

News.Title: ZEEL Board Meeting Scheduled to Discuss Risk Mitigation and Fundraising
News.Summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited (ZEEL) has announced a board meeting on June 16. The meeting's agenda includes exploring risk mitigation strategies and fundraising alternatives. The company plans to involve an investment banker to assess its business plan.
